intro: Eustegia filiformis, commonly known as the slender starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and delicate, thread-like leaves. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a low-growing habit with a creeping stem that produces numerous stolons. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
